name: Grilled Swordfish with Chimichurri Sauce
description: The lively Latin American herb, lemon, and chili sauce known as chimichurri elevates this dish to gourmet status, but the recipe is so easy, you can whip it up on a weeknight. To quickly prep the herbs, just chop off any tough ends, then measure them tender stems and all, loosely packed. Swordfish, in addition to being rich in protein and omega-3s, is also rich in bone-building vitamin D and the antioxidant selenium. While swordfish is a large fish that tends to accumulate more mercury, it can be enjoyed in moderation. However, [current seafood advice](https://www.dietaryguidelines.gov/resources/2020-2025-dietary-guidelines-online-materials) recommends that pregnant and breastfeeding women and young children avoid swordfish and enjoy a variety of other seafood instead. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Rima Kleiner, MS, RDN](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/rima-kleiner-ms-rdn).
steps: Preheat a grill for medium heat (350° to 450°F). Season swordfish on both sides with 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper; set aside.

Put parsley, cilantro, olive oil, red pepper flakes, garlic, and remaining 1/4 tsp. each salt and pepper in a food processor. Add zest and juice of 1 lemon. Pulse chimichurri until well blended. Taste and add a little more salt if  you like. Cut remaining lemon into wedges. Set sauce and lemon aside.

Oil grill grates, using tongs and a wad of paper towels with some vegetable oil. Grill swordfish with lid closed, turning it once, until fish reaches the doneness you like in the thickest part; using a thermometer, aim for 125°F for medium-rare to 145°F for medium-well, 5-7 minutes total.
Transfer swordfish to a platter and top with some of chimichurri sauce. Cut fish into portions and serve with lemon wedges and more chimichurri on the side.

name: Easy Green Bean Casserole
description: For many families, no holiday meal is complete without that comfort-food special, green bean casserole, on the table. Here, instead of the usual canned green beans, we’ve opted for frozen for better color and a tender-crisp texture. But we added extra of everybody’s favorite part of the dish, the french-fried onions. To get a jump-start on the dish, you can thaw the green beans overnight in the fridge, but wait to assemble the casserole until just before baking so the onions stay crisp. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).
steps: If green beans are still frozen, spread them out on a sheet pan for about 1 hour to thaw at room temperature, then pat dry. Meanwhile, preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease a shallow 2-quart baking dish with cooking oil spray.
In a medium bowl, whisk together cream of mushroom soup, chicken broth, and sour cream. Add the green beans and 1 cup french-fried onions and stir gently to combine.
Spoon green beans into the prepared baking dish. Sprinkle with the remaining french-fried onions.
Bake until the casserole is bubbly, 30-35 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper if you like.

name: Country Spice Rubbed Baby Back Ribs
keywords: dry rub seasoning for pork ribs
dry rub for baby back ribs
brown sugar dry rub for pork ribs
rub spices for baby back ribs
description: These fall-off-the-bone, liberally seasoned pork ribs baked right in the oven might just bring out the country in you. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 250°F.
Position a roasting rack inside a large roasting pan. Pour the chicken broth into the pan. Set aside.
Season the pork ribs liberally with salt and black pepper on both sides.
In a small bowl, whisk together the paprika, garlic powder, onion powder, thyme, oregano, ground mustard, cayenne, and brown sugar until combined.
Using a spoon and clean hands, pat the spice rub evenly onto both sides of the pork ribs.
Place the ribs meat side up onto the roasting rack. Cover the pan entirely with a large sheet of aluminum foil. Crimp the foil tightly around the edges of the pan so that no steam can escape.
Roast the ribs on middle rack of oven until they reach an internal temperature of about 180°F and are very tender, 2 1/2-3 hours.
Remove the roasting pan from the oven.
Very carefully remove the foil from the pan.
Set the oven to broil. Broil the ribs on the top rack of oven until the spices begin to darken, 4-5 minutes. Keep a close eye on the ribs to ensure they do not burn.
Check to see that ribs are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow the ribs to cool for 3-4 minutes on the roasting rack. Transfer the pork ribs to a cutting board. With a sharp knife, cut the ribs into desired portions, and serve immediately.

name: Three Cheese Broken Lasagna
description: Any Italian grandmother would call it impossible to conjure up a legit lasagna in under fifteen minutes.  We’re not in the business of defying anybodys Nonna, but we’re about to prove them all wrong.  By breaking up the lasagna noodles, we can get them cooked off quickly.  We pull together a scratch tomato sauce spiked with garlic, chili flakes, and fresh basil.  The epic finish involves over a pound of cheese that, with a little help from the broiler, gets melty and ever so slightly browned.  Sorry Nonna, we’ve got this one in the bag.  Buon appetito!
steps: Turn on your broiler.  Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil for your lasagna noodles.  Grab a large oven-proof pan and place over medium heat. Break apart the lasagna noodles and add them to the pot of boiling, salted water.  Cook for about 4 minutes.

Add the tomatoes to the pan of garlic and season with a pinch of salt.  Reduce the sauce for just a couple minutes.  Add your basil (whole leaves) to the tomato sauce.  Remove your broken lasagna noodles from the pot with some tongs and place them directly into your tomato sauce.  Remove the sauce from the heat.

Grab your mascarpone and mozzarella cheeses.  If you’ve had a tough day, take a moment and squeeze the mozzarella ball for some stress relief.  Tear the cheeses into big chunks and distribute over the top of the tomato sauce and noodles.  Then grate your parm over the entire pan.  Drizzle with a bit of olive oil and grind some black pepper over the top.  Place the pan under the broiler for about a minute.  Once the cheese is melted and the lasagna is a bit browned on top, take it out.
Grab a plate and a big spoon.  Load a heaping helping of lasagna onto your plate.  Garnish with a big grate of parm and enjoy!

name: Tahini-Citrus Power Salad
description: Prepare a tender cook-free kale salad with a creamy lemon-tahini dressing. This filling vegan recipe is perfect for Sunday meal prep because it just gets more delicious over time.

name: Beef and Black Bean Slow Cooker Chili
description: This super easy chili is wonderfully rich and flavorful, with just the right amount of spiciness and the perfect ratio of meat to beans. Chunky salsa, a splash of balsamic vinegar, and classic chili seasonings (chili powder, cumin, and garlic) create a depth of flavor that is sure to please everyone. Feel free to change it up and stir in 2 cups of cooked macaroni for a family-friendly dish. The recipe, which makes 6 1/2 cups, is a Yummly original created by Roxanne Wyss and Kathy Moore of [The Electrified Cooks](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/the-electrified-cooks).
steps: Spray a 4- to 6-qt. slow cooker with nonstick cooking spray. Finely chop onion.

Heat a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and ground beef. Cook, stirring occasionally, until meat is browned and cooked through, 5-7 minutes; drain. Transfer beef and onion to the slow cooker.
Stir in diced tomatoes, salsa, tomato juice, beans, chili powder, vinegar, cumin, and granulated garlic.
Cover slow cooker and cook on Low, stirring occasionally, until chili is simmering and flavors have melded together, about 6 hours.
Ladle chili into bowls. Top with avocado, cheddar cheese, and  jalapeños, if you like.

name: Shakshuka
description: Looking for a healthier breakfast? Try shakshuka! This popular Middle Eastern dish features eggs poached in a deeply-flavored tomato sauce with peppers and flame-roasted onions.

brownie with butter with almond flour

name: Vegan Oatmeal Raisin Cookies
keywords: oatmeal raisin cookies with coconut oil
make cookies without eggs and butter
oatmeal cookies with oil not butter
description: Soft and chewy oatmeal raisin cookies are made without dairy or eggs! Just swing by a supermarket for the special ingredients — coconut oil, nondairy milk (such as almond milk), and flaxseed meal (a great substitute for eggs). The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Line a baking sheet with a silicone baking mat or parchment paper. Set aside.
Place the coconut oil, brown sugar, granulated sugar, molasses, nondairy milk, flaxseed meal, and vanilla extract in a medium bowl. Whisk until smooth and combined.
Add the flour, oats, spices, baking soda, baking powder, and salt to the bowl. Mix with a rubber spatula until a smooth dough forms. Fold in the raisins and walnuts.

Allow the dough to rest for 10 minutes to allow the oats to absorb the excess liquid. Divide the cookie dough into 16 balls, using roughly 1 1/2 tablespoons of dough for each, and arrange them spaced 1 1/2 inches apart on the baking sheet. Transfer the sheet to the freezer for 10-15 minutes. (Alternately, freeze the dough balls on a small tray or large plate and transfer to the baking sheet after freezing.)
Bake the cookies on middle rack of oven until puffy and golden brown at the edges, 13-15 minutes.
Check to see that cookies are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow the cookies to rest on the sheets for 5-10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely before serving.

name: Best Beef Stroganoff
description: Generous cremini mushrooms enhance the meaty flavor, and a rich sour cream sauce cloaks the meat, mushrooms, and egg noodles, making this version of beef stroganoff taste like a special meal. But it comes together fast enough for a weeknight. The recipe, which makes 6 1/2 cups stroganoff and 8 cups noodles, is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).
steps: Bring a large, covered pot of salted water to a boil. Turn off the heat, cover, and set aside.
Meanwhile, thinly slice steak across the grain. Sprinkle all over with 1 tsp. salt and the pepper. Cut onion in half lengthwise, then thinly slice crosswise; set onion aside.

Heat 1 Tbsp. oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. When oil is hot, add half the steak in a single layer and cook until nicely browned on underside, 3-4 minutes. (The steak will release its liquid before browning.) Turn steak over and brown second side, another 2-3 minutes. Transfer steak to a plate and keep warm. Repeat with remaining steak, adding a little more oil if pan is dry.

Add onion and mushrooms to frying pan and cook, stirring occasionally, until onion softens and mushrooms begin to brown, 8-9 minutes. Meanwhile, return pot of water to a boil.  Uncover pot and cook noodles according to package directions. Drain noodles but do not rinse; cover with a pot lid or clean towel to keep warm.

In a medium bowl, whisk together broth, flour, Worcestershire sauce, and Dijon mustard. Add mixture to onions and mushrooms and cook, stirring often, until bubbling and thickened, about 5 minutes. Stir in sour cream and beef. Add more salt and pepper to taste.
Divide noodles among shallow serving bowls or plates. Spoon stroganoff over the noodles and sprinkle with parsley.

name: One-Bowl Ham and Gruyere Scones
keywords: one bowl ham and gruyere scones
description: Tender, buttery, cheesy scones flavored with black pepper and studded with salty bits of ham are the stuff of brunch dreams. Serve them warm alongside softly scrambled eggs. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Jessie Sheehan](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Jessie-Sheehan).
steps: Seal the butter in a small container and freeze until firm, at least 45 minutes.
Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or grease with butter.
Chop the ham into small pieces and coarsely shred the cheese. Set aside.
Place the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and pepper in a large bowl and whisk to combine.
Grate the frozen butter into the flour mixture using the largest holes on a box grater. Toss with your fingers to combine, separating any clumps as needed.
Add the ham and cheese and stir to combine.
Pour the heavy cream into a measuring cup, add the eggs, and whisk to combine.
Pour the cream mixture into flour mixture and stir just until evenly incorporated.

Transfer the dough to a floured work surface. Gather into a ball and knead for one or two turns, just to smooth out the surface. Lightly flour dough and pat into an 8-inch circle. Cut into eight wedges, using a bench scraper or knife. Arrange the wedges on the prepared baking sheet.
Whisk the egg and salt together in the measuring cup and brush onto tops of scones.
Bake the scones on middle rack of oven for 8 minutes.
Rotate pan and continue baking until scones are nicely browned on top, about 10 minutes.
Check to see that scones are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Let scones cool on the baking sheet for about 5 minutes, then serve warm. Scones are best eaten the day they are made, but can be wrapped in plastic wrap and refrigerated for up to three days.

name: Classic Waffles
description: Crispy on the outside, soft and fluffy on the inside, these are everything you want a waffle to be. The secret to the crispiness is a not-so-classic ingredient, cornstarch. Whipped egg whites take care of the tenderness, and buttermilk gives them a bit of tang. Serve the waffles topped with chocolate chips, sliced bananas, and maple syrup, or dream up your own creative toppings. The recipe, which makes 8 waffles (7-inch size), is a Yummly original created by [Dude that Cookz](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/dude-that-cookz).
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Set dry ingredients aside.
Separate egg whites from yolks. Place egg whites in a medium bowl and whip with a mixer on medium-high speed until moist, stiff peaks form when the beaters are lifted, 1 minute. Set aside.
Into a medium bowl, add egg yolks, buttermilk, sugar, melted butter, and vanilla. Beat or whisk wet ingredients until smooth.
Begin heating a waffle iron according to manufacturer’s instructions.
Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients, whisking just until combined; a few small lumps may remain. Carefully fold in egg whites, being sure not to overmix.

Spray hot waffle iron with cooking spray. Add batter to waffle iron according to your waffle iron instructions; for a 4-square waffle iron, pour about 1/3 cup of batter into each waffle section. Cook until waffles are golden-brown, 5-7 minutes.
Serve waffles with with chocolate chips, sliced bananas, and maple syrup if you like. Repeat to cook remaining waffles.

name: Mediterranean White Bean and Tuna Salad
description: This classic Italian salad combines handy canned white beans and tuna for a protein-packed throw-together to serve on a bed of mixed greens at lunch or as a side dish at dinner. Thinly sliced fresh fennel and red bell pepper add juicy crunch. If you’ve never tried anise-flavored fennel, now is the time! But if  you can’t find it, you can substitute celery or cucumber. The recipe, which makes 4 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Ivy Manning](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ivy-Manning).
steps: Put red onion in a small bowl of ice water and set aside for 10 minutes to soften its harsh flavor while you prepare the rest of the salad.

Cut off fennel stalks (the top part that looks like celery, if present) from the bulb. Separate feathery green fronds from stalks and chop them finely to make 1-2 Tbsp. Discard remaining fennel stalks and fronds or save for making stock. Cut out the hard V-shaped core from the bottom of the fennel bulb. Slice fennel crosswise about 1/8 inch thick to make about 1 cup.
Put sliced fennel and chopped fronds in a large serving bowl. Seed and thinly slice red bell pepper and add it to the bowl. Drain onion and add it to the bowl along with beans and tuna.

Put olive oil, lemon juice, mustard, garlic, salt, and pepper in a small jar with a lid or in a small bowl and and shake vigorously or whisk to combine. Pour dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine. Serve immediately, or store in an airtight container in the refrigerator up to 24 hours.

sugar cookie icing with corn syrup

name: Ghraybeh (Middle Eastern Shortbread Cookies)
description: These quintessential Middle Eastern cookies star on tables during special occasions and holidays such as Eid and Christmas. They’re decadent, lightly sweet, and elegant, thanks to a little orange blossom water, which gives these "ordinary" sugar cookies a taste of the East. Look for orange blossom water in grocery stores with cocktail preparations, at any Middle Eastern grocer, or online. The recipe, which makes 16 large cookies, is a Yummly original created by [Rania Renno](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/rania-renno).
steps: In a large mixing bowl or stand mixer bowl, beat butter and powdered sugar on medium-low speed until ingredients are well incorporated, about 3 minutes. Add orange blossom water and mix on low speed for another minute. Turn the mixer off.

Gradually add flour, mixing dough with your hands or a wooden spoon, until ingredients are well combined and no clumps are present. The dough will feel crumbly at first, but keep mixing, pressing together with your hands if needed, until it adheres and forms a ball. Remove dough from bowl, wrap it in plastic wrap or seal in an airtight container, and chill for 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 350°F with racks set in upper and lower third. Line 2 sheet pans with parchment paper.

Using a measuring spoon or a cookie scoop, portion out 2-Tbsp. balls of dough and roll them with your hands until perfectly round. Place on the prepared sheet pans with 2 inches of space between them.
Use your thumb to make an indentation in the center of each cookie, then add 1 pistachio to the center of the indentation. Save any extra nuts for other uses.

Bake cookies, switching pan positions halfway through cooking, until bottoms are light golden (lift with a flexible spatula to check), about 15 minutes. The cookies should remain pale and should not brown in the oven. Traditionally, ghraybeh are a moist cookie. If you’d prefer them drier, bake them a few minutes longer.
Let cookies cool on the sheet pans for 10 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely. If making cookies ahead, chill airtight up to 2 weeks.

name: The Easiest One-Step Perfect Turkey
description: Forget messy brining bags and long ingredient lists with this 5-ingredient dry-brined turkey. Whether it's your first turkey or your 20th, you'll love the simplicity of Ali's go-to turkey recipe.

name: Foolproof Instant Pot White Rice
description: Skip the rice preset button on your Instant Pot! You’ll get quicker and better results by cooking the rice on high pressure for 4 minutes and then letting the steam release naturally for 10 minutes. This cooking time, and the 1:1 rice to water ratio, work beautifully for long-grain white rice, white sushi rice, and white jasmine rice. (But don’t use the recipe for basmati rice or brown rice, which cook differently.) A teaspoon of bouillon powder and a little butter add a delicious flavor, but are totally optional. The recipe, which makes 4 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Ivy Manning](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ivy-Manning).
steps: Remove the inner pot from an Instant Pot. Put rice in the inner pot and add water so the pot is about half full. Swish the rice with your hand several times, then drain it in a fine-mesh strainer. Return the rice to the pot. Repeat with more cold water, drain again, and return the rice to the pot.

Put the inner pot in the Instant Pot. Add 1 1/2 cups cold water, and bouillon powder, if using. Lock on the lid and adjust the steam valve to “sealing.” Press the pressure cook button and adjust to high pressure. Set the timer for 4 minutes.
When the cooking cycle is done, let the steam release naturally for 10 minutes (set a timer). Release any remaining pressure.
Add butter, if using, and fluff rice with a fork.

name: Porchetta
description: Take Sunday supper up a notch with this impressive rosemary and fennel flecked pork rib roast from Umbria. Debone, butterfly, score and tie your roast, then cook it to perfection at Daniel's side.

name: Mini Red Velvet Cheesecakes
description: Can’t decide between rich and creamy cheesecake or tender red velvet cake with its hint of vanilla and cocoa? With this cupcake-sized recipe you get to enjoy both! The layered dessert makes an impressive statement for Valentine’s Day or any special occasion, but it’s easy to pull off. (The hardest part is waiting 4 hours for it to chill.) Just bake mini layers of red velvet cake, then top them with a no-bake cheesecake filling. At serving time, add your favorite store-bought chocolate sauce and fresh raspberries. The recipe, which makes 12 mini cheesecakes, is a Yummly original created by [Annalise Sandberg] (https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/annalise-sandberg).
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a regular, 12-cup muffin pan with paper cupcake liners.
In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, 3 Tbsp. sugar, the cocoa powder, salt, baking powder, and baking soda.
In a small bowl, whisk together buttermilk, oil, egg yolk, food coloring, and 1/2 tsp. vanilla. Add to the dry ingredients and whisk until combined into a smooth batter.

Divide cake batter equally among the cupcake liners, about 1 Tbsp. each, spreading it so the batter covers the bottom in a thin layer. For the cleanest look, take care to avoid dripping the batter on the sides of the liner papers.

Bake cupcakes until the centers are firm and springy when gently pressed, 7-8 minutes. Remove from oven to a wire rack and let cool completely (about 15 minutes) while you prepare the cheesecake filling.

In the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the paddle attachment (or in a large bowl using a hand-held mixer), beat cream cheese, remaining 1/4 cup sugar, and remaining 1/2 tsp. vanilla on medium-high speed until smooth and creamy, about 2 minutes. Transfer cream cheese mixture to a clean medium bowl.

In the same mixer bowl (if using a paddle attachment, switch out for the whisk attachment), beat whipping cream on high speed until it’s thick and holds medium peaks when the beater is lifted, 3-4 minutes. Gently fold whipped cream into cream cheese mixture in 2 additions until cheesecake filling is combined but still light and fluffy.

Spoon or scoop even amounts of cheesecake filling into each cupcake liner (a spring-loaded #20/3-Tbsp. cookie scoop is the perfect size to evenly divide the filling). Smooth batter into a flat, even layer, using the back of a spoon or a small metal offset spatula.
Chill desserts uncovered in the muffin pan until cheesecake layer feels firm, at least 4 hours.

If needed, microwave hot fudge or set the jar in a bowl of warm water just until the sauce has loosened enough to spoon easily over the cupcakes without dripping over the edges. Sauce should not feel warm. Spoon about 1 tsp. sauce on top of each mini cheesecake and then add a few raspberries. If making cheesecakes ahead, chill them up to 2 days in the muffin pan covered with plastic wrap or in an airtight container (they’ll keep best in a container). You can store cheesecakes with fudge sauce on top up to 5 hours, but add raspberries just before serving.

name: Palestinian Sumac Chicken Rolls (Musakhan)
description: Our simplified version of the national dish of Palestine (musakhan), seasoned with lemony ground sumac, stars cooked shredded chicken and readily available tortillas. In Palestine, the dish traditionally celebrates the new olive oil harvest and is made as a flatbread. The flatbread, called taboon, is baked on rocks and topped with sauteed onions and roasted chicken with sumac and olive oil. Serve this quicker version as you would the traditional one, accompanied by pickles and a green salad. Look for sumac in the spice aisle at well-stocked supermarkets. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Rania Renno](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/rania-renno).
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F with a rack set in upper third of oven. Slice onions in half vertically, then cut each into long, thin strips.
Heat 1/2 cup olive oil in a 12-inch cast-iron skillet or other frying pan over medium heat. Add onions and cook, stirring occasionally, until they’re very limp and light golden, about 30 minutes.

Reduce heat to medium-low. Stir in sumac and salt to combine, then add chicken and stir to incorporate. Cook, stirring often, until chicken is hot and flavors are blended, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat.

Oil a 9x13-inch baking dish or other baking dish large enough to fit all of the rolls. To fill musakhan rolls, lay a few tortillas flat on a work surface. Top each across the lower third with a generous 1/2 cup of the chicken mixture, arranging it in a band. Tightly roll each tortilla, leaving the ends open. The tortillas will look like large cigars once fully rolled. Arrange rolls in the prepared baking dish.
Repeat to fill remaining tortillas. Brush rolls with the remaining 2 Tbsp. olive oil to coat well.
Bake musakhan until the tops are crispy and golden brown, 15-20 minutes.
Sprinkle musakhan rolls across the center with a little more sumac. Serve with pickles, and season to taste with more salt if you like.

name: Hoisin Glazed Brussels Sprouts
keywords: brussel sprouts with garlic and onions

name: Pasta No Carb-onara
description: It may not be authentic, but Richard doesn't care! This gluten-free carbonara features a creamy two-cheese sauce and crispy bacon for a quick, lo-carb dish perfect for an indulgent weeknight meal.

name: Caramel Apple Cobbler
keywords: easy desserts from scratch from scratch

name: Banana Bread
keywords: healthy banana bread with yogurt in
healthy low fat low sugar banana bread

name: Ground Beef Dirty Rice
keywords: quick and easy ground beef and rice

name: Ground Beef Dirty Rice
keywords: quick and easy ground beef and rice

name: Jollof Rice
description: This vegan dish is best wood-fired, but never fear — Chef Tunde shares a way to get that smoky flavor using your stove. Fermented locust beans are the trick to adding umami.

name: Navy Bean and Ham Soup
keywords: navy bean soup with ham bone

name: Irish Colcannon
keywords: cooking with half and half milk

name: 5-Minute Frozen Yogurt
steps: Add the blueberries, honey, yogurt and lemon juice to the work bowl of your KitchenAid® Pro Line® Series Food Processor. Process the ingredients for 5 minutes until smooth. Serve the frozen yogurt immediately topped with toasted coconut (recipe follows), or store it in an airtight container in the freezer until ready to serve.

Optional Topping: Preheat your KitchenAid® 12″ Convection Bake Countertop Oven to 350°F. Line the countertop oven baking tray with parchment paper then spread the flaked coconut in an even layer. Toast the coconut for about 10 minutes, stirring as needed, until it’s golden brown. Serve atop the blueberry frozen yogurt.

name: Loaded Mashed Potatoes
description: It's a mashed potato mash-up! Your favorite creamy mashed potatoes meet loaded potato skins in this crowd-pleasing mash studded with crispy twice-baked potato skins, bacon, and chives.

name: Shake-in-a-Jar Mediterranean Salad Dressing Recipe with Red Wine Vinegar, Lemon, and Sumac
keywords: salad dressing oil red wine vinegar
red wine vinegar salad dressing olive oil
lemon olive oil and vinegar salad dressing
red wine vinegar olive oil dressing
greek salad dressing red wine vinegar

name: Broiled Salmon with Zesty Cabbage Slaw
description: Learn to broil salmon so the fish cooks evenly while getting perfectly crisp and browned. A zesty slaw (with a secret ingredient) creates the perfect mix of refreshing, clean, and delicious.

name: Slow Cooker Chicken Paprikash
description: Say hello to a new family favorite that just got extra-easy with our slow-cooker version. This famous Hungarian chicken dish is beautifully creamy, with rich flavors of tomatoes, bell pepper, and paprika. Since paprika is the primary seasoning, you're going to want a kind you love. We recommend sweet Hungarian paprika, which has loads of complexity. Of course, you can reduce the amount of paprika and omit the cayenne if you’re looking for a milder dish, or choose hot Hungarian paprika if you love heat. The recipe is a Yummly original created by Roxanne Wyss and Kathy Moore of [The Electrified Cooks](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/the-electrified-cooks).
steps: Spray a 4- to 6-qt. slow cooker with cooking spray. Thinly slice onion and bell pepper.
Place sliced vegetables in the slow cooker and arrange chicken thighs evenly over them. Sprinkle paprika, garlic, salt, and cayenne over the chicken and vegetables, then pour tomatoes evenly the top.
Cover slow cooker and cook on Low until chicken and vegetables are tender, 3-4 hours.
Bring a pot of salted water to a boil. Cover, turn off heat, and set aside.
Meanwhile, with a slotted spoon, transfer chicken and vegetables from slow cooker to a serving bowl and cover to keep warm.

Increase slow cooker to High. In a small bowl, blend flour with cold water, stirring until very smooth. Pour flour mixture into liquid in slow cooker, whisking until blended. Cover and cook on High until sauce is bubbly around the edges and slightly thickened, about 15 minutes.
Return salted water to boiling. Cook noodles according to package directions, until tender.
Blend sour cream into liquid in slow cooker, stirring until smooth. Ladle sour cream sauce over the chicken and vegetables.
Arrange noodles in a deep platter or wide serving bowl and top with chicken, vegetables, and sour cream-tomato sauce. Sprinkle with parsley.

name: Martina Mcbride's Creamy Chicken Tortilla Soup
Turkey BLT Wraps
description: This wrap version of a turkey BLT sandwich has a secret to prevent the sogginess that plagues other wraps: A thin layer of taco-seasoned cream cheese spread on the tortilla keeps the wrap from soaking up moisture from the turkey, lettuce, and tomato. The wraps will last, tightly wrapped in plastic, in the refrigerator for 24 hours, so they’re great for school or office lunches. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ivy Manning](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ivy-Manning).
steps: Line a microwave-safe plate with a paper towel. Put bacon on the paper towel in an even layer. Cover with a second paper towel and microwave on high heat, stopping once to flip bacon slices, until crisp, about 4 minutes. Alternatively, fry bacon in a nonstick frying pan over medium heat, turning once, until crisp, 5 minutes per side. Set bacon aside, then coarsely crumble once it’s cool.
In a small bowl, combine cream cheese, green chiles, and taco seasoning, stirring with a spoon until ingredients are thoroughly combined. Set aside.
Thinly slice tomato (or tomatoes) to make 12-16 slices. Pat lettuce and tomatoes dry with paper towels.

Spread cream cheese mixture evenly over tortillas, using an offset spatula if you have one, and leaving 1/2 inch uncovered around the edges. Place a lettuce leaf in the center of each tortilla so it covers most of the tortilla. Add turkey in an even layer (about 3 slices per wrap) over the lettuce. Arrange 3-4 tomato slices in a line in the center of each wrap. Top tomatoes with one-quarter of the bacon per wrap.

Fold in about 1 inch on opposite sides of each tortilla. Starting with an unfolded edge closest to you, tightly roll up each tortilla into a cylinder. Position wraps on a cutting board seam side-down. Use a serrated knife to cut each wrap in half on an angle.
Serve wraps; or seal each in plastic wrap or place in an airtight container and refrigerate up to 24 hours.

name: Sheet-Pan Halibut with Mediterranean Vegetables
description: Sheet-pan suppers are the key to low-effort, high-flavor weeknight meals. Featuring fresh ingredients and lean fish, this dish ensures that everything is ready at once — and cleanup is minimal.
steps: An introduction to Sheet-Pan Halibut with Mediterranean Vegetables with Cameron Rogers (Click on this step or "Make It Now" to view introduction.)
Preheat the oven to 375°F.

Strain the artichokes and olives and transfer to a mixing bowl. Remove the cores and stems from the bell peppers and cut into 1/4-inch-wide strips. Transfer the peppers to the bowl with the artichokes and olives. Add the tomatoes.

Line a sheet pan with parchment paper. Transfer the contents of the bowl to the prepared pan and season with the oregano, kosher salt, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes. Roast in the oven until olives start to shrivel and tomatoes begin to blister, about 10 minutes.
As the vegetables roast, season the fish on parchment paper with salt, pepper, oregano, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes.
Remove the vegetables from the oven. Place the fish on top of the vegetables. Return to the oven and cook until the fish is cooked through and no longer translucent, about 10 minutes.
Check to see that the fish is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.

Use tongs and a spatula to transfer the fish to serving plates, evenly dividing the vegetables between each serving. Coarsely chop a few parsley leaves and sprinkle a little over each serving for garnish, and serve.

name: Balsamic Grilled Flank Steak and Vegetables
description: A simple all-in-one marinade infuses sweet and umami flavors into the steak and veggies for this perfect summertime meal. The balsamic vinegar and brown sugar are key to getting a nice brown crust on the outside of the steak. Plus, the longer everything sits in that marinade, the more flavor you’ll have — so feel free to get a jump on the recipe a day ahead! (Note that the time to make the recipe includes at least 4 hours marinating.) Servings here are generous, and if you add more corn, the recipe can serve 6. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).
steps: In a small bowl, whisk together vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, oil, garlic, and crushed red pepper flakes. Set aside 1/4 cup marinade in the refrigerator.

Stem and seed bell peppers and cut into quarters. Place red peppers, steak, and mushrooms in a shallow dish or large zip-top bag. Pour remaining marinade over the vegetables and meat. Cover dish or seal bag and refrigerate at least 4 hours and up to overnight, turning occasionally.

Preheat a grill to medium-high heat (400° to 450°F). Discard balsamic marinade from steak and vegetables. Sprinkle steak, peppers, and mushrooms with salt and pepper. Shuck corn and trim root ends from green onions.

Grill steak, corn, peppers, mushrooms, and green onions in batches with the lid closed: Grill steak, turning it once, until medium-rare (130° to 140°F, or done the way you like), 12-14 minutes total. Transfer to a cutting board, tent with foil, and let rest about 15 minutes. Grill corn, basting with the reserved marinade, 8-10 minutes, turning occasionally; transfer to board. Grill mushrooms and peppers, turning once, until tender and browned, 4-8 minutes total; transfer to board. Grill green onions until charred and tender, about 1 minute, then set on board.
Slice steak across the grain, slice mushrooms about 1 inch thick, and serve steak with vegetables.

name: The Best Fire Roasted Salsa with Divine Flavor Tomatoes
Curried Salmon Burger and Avocado Salad
description: For a light and flavorful meal, try salmon burgers zipped up with curry seasonings on a bed of greens in lieu of the usual buns. Salmon (in this case, less-expensive canned salmon) provides a generous serving of heart-healthy omega-3s. The burgers cook up quickly, making for an easy lunch or dinner. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Rima Kleiner, MS, RDN](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/rima-kleiner-ms-rdn).
steps: Whirl oats in a food processor until finely ground. Add salmon (break up large chunks with a fork), eggs, 1 tsp. curry powder, 3/4 tsp. pepper, the mustard, paprika, turmeric, garlic powder, and 1/4 tsp. salt. Pulse to combine.

Spoon 4 portions of salmon mixture onto a plate. Pat out each into a cake about 1/2 inch thick and 3 inches wide. Cover and freeze for 10 minutes. (This helps the oats absorb the moisture and helps the burgers hold their shape.)
While patties are chilling, in a large bowl, stir together 1 Tbsp. olive oil, 1/8 tsp. salt, and remaining 1/4 tsp.  each pepper and curry powder; set dressing aside.
Seed and core bell pepper, halve lengthwise, and slice crosswise. Quarter avocado lengthwise, pit, and peel. Slice crosswise. Set vegetables aside.

Heat remaining 2 Tbsp. olive oil in a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat. With a wide spatula, carefully transfer salmon patties to oil (they will be soft but will firm up as they’re heated). Cook, turning once, until golden brown, 8-10 minutes total.

Toss salad greens and bell pepper with dressing to coat. Add half of avocado and toss again. Divide among serving plates. Top each salad with a salmon burger and then some of the remaining avocado. Serve with lemon wedges to squeeze over salmon cakes and salad, and add more salt to taste if you like.

name: Winter Comfort Bowl with Curry-Spiced Chickpeas
description: Mix up a bowl of flavor with this vegetarian feast of healthy, soul-soothing foods. Roasted curry chickpeas make a crunchy, craveable topping that will become a favorite snack and salad topping.

name: Vegan Lemon Garlic Angel Hair Pasta
Eggless Egg Free Tapioca Pudding
keywords: low fat sugar free tapioca pudding

name: Burgundy Beef
keywords: pot roast beef with pearl onions
red wine pot roast with mushrooms

name: Funfetti Layer Cake with Buttercream Frosting
Greek Quinoa Bowls with Ground Lamb
description: Za’atar — a Middle Eastern spice blend of sesame, sumac, and herbs — brings a fresh dimension of flavor to this protein-packed bowl topped with tangy crumbles of feta cheese.

name: Herb and Citrus Roasted Olives
description: Looking for an easy appetizer? These warm seasoned olives take only a few minutes to make and always hit the spot. You can serve them on their own with drinks, set them out as part of a party spread, or serve them with a charcuterie board. And yes, they keep well if you want to make them ahead. The recipe, which makes 2 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Sher Castellano](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/sher-castellano).
steps: Preheat oven to 350˚F with a rack set in the center.
Combine olives, olive oil, 1 tsp. orange zest, the rosemary, fennel seeds, and pepper in a small bowl. Pour mixture into an 8-inch square baking dish.
Roast olives until they’re sizzling, 13-15 minutes.
Set aside a pinch of the remaining 1 tsp. orange zest for garnish. Sprinkle remaining orange zest and the parsley over olives and lightly toss to coat.
Spoon olives into a serving bowl and sprinkle with reserve orange zest and a few rosemary leaves. Serve warm or at room temperature. If making ahead, chill airtight up to 3 days.

name: Spice-Rubbed Chicken Pan Roast with Sweet Potatoes
description: Fill your kitchen with the comforting aromas of roast chicken in this easy one-pot meal. Learn to spatchcock a chicken to maximize flavor, shorten the cooking time, and make carving a breeze.

name: Piña Coladas
description: One sip of this classic cocktail that’s known as the national drink of Puerto Rico and you’ll be transported to a beach in the tropics. If you like, you can cut up your own pineapple, freeze some chunks overnight to use in the drinks, and then save some small fresh pieces for garnishing the glasses. Look for cream of coconut such as Coco Lopez with cocktail supplies (don’t use the thicker, unsweetened coconut cream that’s sometimes sold alongside coconut milk). Don’t forget paper umbrellas to tuck into the drinks! The recipe, which makes about 4 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).
steps: Combine ice, frozen pineapple, pineapple juice, cream of coconut, white and dark rums, and lime juice in a blender. Blend until smooth.
Pour mixture evenly into 4 glasses. Garnish each glass with a pineapple slice and cherry.

name: Queso Blanco Dip ~ Spicy White Cheese Dip
Filipino Chicken Adobo
description: Here’s how to simmer your way to succulent, glistening, Filipino-style chicken that’s deeply flavored with garlic, black pepper, soy sauce, and vinegar. You can cook the adobo in one fell swoop, or start it one night and finish the next. For the most authentic flavor, head to an Asian market or online for the Filipino soy sauce, which is saltier than others and will do the heavy lifting when seasoning the chicken. Filipino sugarcane vinegar is worth seeking out for its unique perfumey quality. For simmering the chicken, go with chicken broth for a more savory dish, or try pineapple juice for a sweet note. The adobo is flexible; to stretch the meal, you can toss in peeled and cubed potato, green unripe papaya, chayote, or peeled hard-boiled eggs in the last 10 minutes of cooking. For those who love fire, add some fresh chilies. Don’t forget a side of white rice! The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Jenn de la Vega](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/jenn-de-la-vega).
steps: Peel garlic cloves, slice in half lengthwise, and smash each half with the side of a knife, pestle, or the bottom of a sturdy mug. Set aside.
Set chicken on a sheet pan or plate and lightly salt it on both sides.

Heat a Dutch oven or other heavy-bottomed 5- to 6-qt. pot over medium-high heat. Set chicken pieces in the pot skin-side down (without oil, and part at a time if needed) and sear until golden brown on the underside, 4-6 minutes. Turn chicken over with a wide metal spatula and sear the second side, another 3 minutes.

Remove pan from heat and let chicken cool 15 minutes. Add soy sauce, sugarcane vinegar, apple cider vinegar, garlic, coarsely ground black pepper, peppercorns, and bay leaves. Let chicken marinate about 30 minutes at room temperature, turning chicken over halfway through, or refrigerate it overnight, also turning it over halfway through.

Add chicken broth and bring the chicken and liquid to a boil, uncovered, over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer chicken uncovered, turning it every 10-15 minutes, until the meat is fork-tender, it takes on the brown tinge of the sauce, and reaches 185°F in the thickest part on an instant-read thermometer, about 45 minutes. If the liquid evaporates too quickly before the chicken is done, reduce heat and add 1 cup water once or twice to keep some liquid in the bottom of the pan.

Transfer chicken to a large bowl or platter. Increase heat under the pot to high and boil the sauce, stirring occasionally, until reduced to 1 to 1 1/2 cups, 3-5 minutes. Season the sabaw (liquid) with salt to taste, if you like. Pour the hot liquid over the chicken. Scatter some sliced Thai chilies on top if you like and serve with rice.

name: Whole Roasted Togarashi Cauliflower
description: Learn to balance flavors and textures with this dramatic vegetarian entree featuring shichimi togarashi (a Japanese seasoning blend) combined with yogurt, hazelnuts, and bright notes of yuzu oil and lemon. To buy specialty ingredients used in this recipe, visit [Snuk Foods](https://snukfoods.com/).

name: Simple Ceviche
description: This colorful, refreshing marinated fish salad is always a hit as an appetizer, and it’s easy to make. All you do is combine cubed raw fish with a citrus marinade to “cook,” then blend in spicy chili, sweet tomato, and silky avocado. Don’t let the long marinade time fool you — the recipe requires only 15 minutes hands-on time. Serve with tortilla chips or soft butter lettuce leaves to enjoy every bite. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Rima Kleiner, MS, RDN](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/rima-kleiner-ms-rdn).
steps: Cut fish into 1/2-inch cubes.
In a low-sided glass or ceramic baking dish, or in a wide bowl, combine fish, onion, lime juice, and lemon juice, making sure fish is fully covered. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour.

Stir mixture, making sure all fish is still covered with juice. Cover and refrigerate another 3 hours. As fish marinates, it will turn from pinkish-gray to translucent and then to white, almost opaque.

Shortly before fish is done marinating, mince garlic, finely chop chili (including seeds), chop tomatoes into 1/2-inch pieces, and chop cilantro. Chop avocado, if you’ll be serving the ceviche right away (otherwise, wait to chop it until shortly before serving). Set ingredients aside.
Drain fish in a colander, discarding juices.

In a large bowl, mix together garlic, chili, tomatoes, cilantro, and olive oil. Stir in fish; then season with salt and sugar, mixing well. If serving ceviche immediately, gently stir in avocado. Or cover and refrigerate ceviche up to 3 hours and add avocado right before serving. Taste ceviche and add more chili and salt if you like. Serve with tortilla chips.

name: Perfect Dinner Rolls
keywords: dairy free egg free dinner rolls
homemade dinner rolls without milk with instant yeast

name: Dark Chocolate Coconut Bars (gluten, grain, dairy free, paleo)
keywords: gluten free dairy free sugar free desserts
gluten free wheat free dairy free sugar free
dairy free egg free nut free desserts
description: I have linked to the products from my affiliate partners that I personally use and recommend. If you purchase through one of these links, I may earn a small commission.

name: Grilled Swordfish with Salmoriglio
description: Perfectly grilled swordfish is all about technique — and a zesty, well-balanced sauce. Daniel provides expert guidance on everything from choosing fillets to plating your fish.

name: Cranberry-Glazed Acorn Squash
description: Looking for a last-minute holiday side that feels impressive but takes little effort? Look no further. So many favorite fall flavors come together in this savory and delicious sheet-pan side, from earthy squash to buttery pecans and tangy sweet cranberry. While it’s perfect for a special meal, we predict you’ll be making it all season long. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Ashley Strickland Freeman](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ashley-Strickland-Freeman).
steps: Preheat oven to 425°F. Meanwhile, set a sheet pan in oven to heat and put pecans in a pie pan (on top of sheet pan) to toast until golden and crisp, 8-12 minutes. Remove pecans from oven and set aside.

With a large, sturdy knife, cut a thin slice off the stem ends of each squash so you have a flat base; discard stems. Stand each squash on flat side and cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out and discard seeds. Cut squash crosswise into 3/4-inch-thick slices. In a large bowl, combine 2 Tbsp. olive oil, the salt, and pepper. Add squash and toss to coat.
When oven has preheated, remove hot sheet pan and carefully arrange squash in a single layer.
Bake squash until underside is light brown, about 10 minutes. Turn slices over with a wide spatula. Bake until squash is just tender when pierced with a small knife, about 10 more minutes.
Meanwhile, in a glass measuring cup, stir together cranberry sauce, honey, remaining 1 tsp. olive oil, the vinegar, and mustard. Microwave just until steaming, about 1 minute.

Remove squash from oven. You can serve from the sheet pan or transfer squash at this point to 1 or 2 large platters. Drizzle small spoonfuls of cranberry glaze on squash slices. Sprinkle squash with goat cheese, pecans, and thyme leaves. Tuck in a few thyme sprigs if you like.

name: Three-Bean Weight Watchers Chili | ZERO Points
keywords: low point recipes for weight watchers

name: Orange Chestnut Salad
description: This 6-ingredient salad is a light and bright addition to your winter table. In this recipe, you'll learn how to supreme an orange and make a miso-sherry dressing from scratch.

name: Ponche Navideño (Mexican Christmas Punch)
description: A warm mug of fruity, spiced Ponche Navideño always sets a holiday mood, whether you’re singing carols, hosting a holiday party, or hanging out wrapping gifts. Imagine spiced apple cider but with more complex flavors from piloncillo (unrefined sugar with a caramel flavor), tangy dried hibiscus flowers, cinnamon, star anise, cloves, and fruits such as guava, orange, apples, pears, and sugarcane, all sold at Latin supermarkets. The recipe is flexible and you can use what’s available in your area. For adults, a “piquete,” or sting, of tequila makes the drink extra cozy. The recipe, which makes 14 cups, is a Yummly original created by [Ericka Sanchez](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ericka-Sanchez).
steps: Bring water to a boil in a Dutch oven or other 5- to 6-qt. pot over medium-high heat. Meanwhile, quarter and core apples and pear lengthwise (don’t peel fruit). Slice apples, pear, and sugarcane (if using) crosswise about 1/2 inch thick. Set fruit aside.
Add piloncillo, 1 cinnamon stick, the hibiscus, cloves, and star anise to water and reduce heat to medium-low. Cook, stirring, until piloncillo dissolves, about 5 minutes.
Add apples, pear, sugarcane, and prunes; simmer, partially covered so the ponche doesn’t boil over, for 20 minutes.

While punch simmers, quarter the guavas, if using. Slice oranges into thin rounds. Add guavas and orange slices to punch and simmer for 5 minutes to blend flavors and soften fruit a bit. Remove from heat.

Serve punch hot, scooping liquid and fruit into mugs and adding a splash of tequila if you like. Garnish each serving with a cinnamon stick. Sip the punch, nibbling on the fruit and discarding the fruit peels, hibiscus flowers, and spices.

name: The Best Fire Roasted Salsa with Divine Flavor Tomatoes
Beef and Red Chile Tamales
description:
Of all the foods enjoyed for Las Posadas (the Christmas Nativity story celebrated in Latin America and parts of the United States each December), tamales might be the most loved — and these tamales are among the best you’ll find. Tender shreds of beef drenched in red chile sauce, plus potato, carrot, pickled jalapeño, and green olives, all get wrapped in corn masa that’s seasoned with more chile sauce. 

Five different types of chiles give the sauce flavors of smoky, bitter, spicy, and sweet to create a well balanced sauce. You can find them online and at a Latin grocery store. If they’re not all available you can go with more pasilla, New Mexico, or guajillo chiles, but always include a dark chile such as mulato, ancho, or chile negro to balance out the bitterness of the others. 

Making tamales is a big project, ideally for at least a few people to share and spread out over a couple of days. You’re going to need a large stand mixer to beat the masa so it comes out fluffy, and a 32-qt. tamale steamer, though you can also steam the tamales in batches in a 10- to 12-qt. pot. Enjoy the tamales on their own, or serve them with sour cream or creme fraiche, salsa, rice, and beans. The recipe, which makes 40 tamales, is a Yummly original created by [Ericka Sanchez](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Ericka-Sanchez).
steps: Make filling: Bring 3 qt. water to a boil in a 6- to 8-qt. pot over high heat. Meanwhile, cut beef into 2-inch chunks, trimming any large chunks of fat (it’s OK to leave some). Add beef to water along with 1 whole onion, 6 garlic cloves, 3 allspice berries, the bay leaves, and oregano, and reduce heat to medium. Return to a boil, then boil meat uncovered for 15 minutes, skimming off foam with a wide metal spoon.
Add 1 Tbsp. salt to beef. Cover pot, reduce heat to low, and simmer beef until it’s very tender when pierced with a fork, about 2 hours.

Meanwhile, if you’re filling the tamales on the same day as cooking the beef, separate corn husks and rinse of any debris or silks. Place husks in a large bowl and soak in hot water weighted down with a couple of plates until husks are soft, at least 1 hour. Otherwise, wait to soak the husks until the day you fill the tamales (see Step 9).

While the beef is cooking, rinse dried chiles. Cut off stems, using kitchen shears (no need to remove seeds; they’ll be strained out later). Put chiles in a large saucepan. Add water to cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer chiles uncovered until they’re softened but not falling apart, about 15 minutes. Transfer chiles with a slotted spoon to a bowl and set aside. Discard cooking liquid.

With a slotted spoon, transfer cooked beef from broth to a large bowl. Let stand until cool enough to handle, then tear into shreds. Pour broth through a fine strainer into a separate bowl. Measure broth and add water if needed to make 10 1/2 cups. Season broth with salt to taste if you like. Cover broth to keep warm; discard contents of strainer.

Working in batches if needed, add soaked chiles to a blender container along with 3 cups of the reserved beef broth, 2 garlic cloves, the coriander, remaining 9 allspice berries, and 1 tsp. salt. Blend until smooth. Pour and then rub sauce through a fine strainer into a bowl. Discard contents of strainer. You’ll have about 3 1/2 cups chile sauce; set aside.

Slice remaining onion lengthwise into strips and slice fresh jalapeño lengthwise into thin strips. Heat oil in a 4- to 5-qt. saucepan over medium-low heat. Add 2 garlic cloves, the onion strips, and fresh jalapeño strips and cook, stirring often, until onion begins to soften but not burn, 4-5 minutes.

Add shredded beef and continue to stir. Set aside 1 cup red chile sauce for masa and add the rest, about 2 1/2 cups, to the beef. (Save any extra sauce for other uses.) Stir beef mixture until evenly distributed; then cover and simmer for 15 minutes to blend flavors, reducing heat if meat starts to stick. Remove garlic. Season with salt to taste if you like. (At this point, you can cool, cover, and chill the beef filling up to 1 day; use it cold. Also cool and chill the remaining beef broth; reheat until warm to touch before making the masa. And chill the reserved 1 cup red chile sauce; reheat to room temperature before using.)

Soak corn husks if you made the filling ahead (see step 3). Make masa: Place lard in a bowl of a large stand mixer (preferably at least 5 qt.) fitted with the paddle attachment. Beat on high speed until lard looks light and silky and resembles whipped marshmallows, about 15 minutes, scraping inside of bowl occasionally.

Add masa harina, remaining 1 Tbsp. salt, and the baking powder and blend on low speed until mixture resembles wet sand. Slowly add 7 1/2 cups beef broth and the reserved 1 cup red chile sauce, scraping sides of bowl to mix well. Continue mixing on low speed until masa is fluffy and spreadable, 15-20 minutes. To check if masa is ready for spreading, drop a small piece of masa into a glass of cold water. If the masa floats, it’s ready. If it sinks, continue mixing and repeat the test every 5 minutes. Save any remaining beef broth for other uses.
While the masa is mixing, prepare vegetables for tamales: Peel carrots and potatoes and cut into sticks about 2 inches long and 1/4 inch wide.

Assemble tamales, ideally with several people (someone to spread masa, another person to add fillings, and another to fold tamales). Drain water from corn husks. Choose the largest husks. Open up a corn husk on a work surface with the pointy edge facing you. Spoon 1/3 cup masa into the center. Holding the husk at the straight end with one hand, and using a soup spoon with the other, spread masa on the wide part of the husk into a rectangle that extends about two-thirds of the way from the flat end to the pointy end, leaving a 1/2-inch border clear along the straight edge to avoid any masa spilling as it steams, and about 1 inch clear on the sides for easy wrapping.

To the center of the spread masa, add a loosely packed 1/4 cup beef filling in a band, and then a carrot strip, a potato strip, an olive, and a slice of pickled jalapeño on top of the meat. Fold one side of the husk snugly towards the center (but not too tight, as the masa expands during cooking). Fold the other side of the husk snugly towards the center, making sure the sides are well overlapped. Then fold the pointy edge up, making sure the sides don’t spread open, so as to prevent steam from getting into the tamales. (The straight edge will be open.) If any husks get filled but then are difficult to fold up, you can double-wrap the whole tamale with another husk. Repeat with the remaining masa and filling. (At this point, you can wrap each tamale in parchment paper, then freeze in zip-top bags up to 6 months. Freeze any leftover masa in an airtight container up to 3 months.)

Cook tamales: Fill a 32-qt. tamale steamer with water to the fill line (at least 1/2 inch under the position for the steaming rack), then add rack. Arrange tamales in steamer on the rack with the straight (unsealed) edges upright, touching each other but not packed, so there’s room for steam to circulate. (If you don’t have a tamale steamer, use a large pot, a least 10-qt. size. Add 1 inch water, set a steamer basket or flat metal colander in place at least 1 1/2 inches above the bottom of the pan, and cook tamales in batches.) Cover tamales with any remaining corn husks and 2-3 clean kitchen towels to help contain some of the steam.

Place steamer over medium-high heat, cover with lid, and bring water to a boil. Reduce heat to medium or medium-low so the water is constantly boiling to circulate the steam. Set timer for 1 1/2 hours (or 2 1/2 hours if tamales are frozen). Have a kettle with hot water nearby to add to steamer as water evaporates (check by pushing aside the towels and corn husks on top with a long wooden spoon). Pour in hot water as needed, adding it slowly against the side of the pan to make sure it does not spill on the inside of tamales.

Turn off heat. To check that tamales are done, unwrap one partway; the masa should no longer stick to the husk. Let tamales rest in steamer, covered, for 20 minutes. Carefully remove a tamale with tongs and place on a plate. Unwrap and check again for doneness; the husk should come off easily. If it doesn’t, bring the water back up to boiling, steam tamales another 30 minutes, and let them rest again. Cooked tamales can also be frozen in zip-top bags up to 6 months.

name: Healthy Breakfast Strawberry Banana Smoothie
keywords: healthy strawberry banana smoothie without yogurt

name: Tamarind Malaysian Lamb Ribs with Fish-Salt Potatoes
description: Transport your taste buds to another dimension with lamb ribs marinated with Malaysian curry, tamarind-date sauce, and dried curry leaves. Bonus points for the umami-rich gold potatoes! To buy specialty ingredients used in this recipe, visit [Snuk Foods](https://snukfoods.com/).

name: Easy 3 Ingredient Chocolate Weight Watchers Muffins
The Best Fire Roasted Salsa with Divine Flavor Tomatoes
Avocado Gazpacho
description: Last minute guests? The Potash twins have a simple but sophisticated recipe for that. Chop, blend, and chill your way to a refreshing gazpacho, and get plating tips to really wow your friends.

name: Southern Shrimp and Grits
description: Nothing says comfort like a bowl of soothing, creamy grits topped with juicy shrimp and zipped up with Creole seasoning and as much hot sauce as you’re craving. A splash of wine adds lots of flavor to the shrimp pan juices. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Cooks with Soul](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Cooks-with-Soul).
steps: Bring water to a boil in a covered 4- to 5-qt. saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir in grits and cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until thickened,10-15 minutes; reduce heat if needed to contain spattering.
Remove grits from heat and stir in 1/2 tsp. salt and the half-and-half. Cover to keep warm and set aside.
Meanwhile, melt 2 Tbsp. butter in a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat. Add garlic and shallot and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add shrimp to frying pan and cook, turning shrimp halfway through cooking, until they’re light pink and partially opaque, about 3 minutes.

Pour in wine and season shrimp with Creole seasoning, remaining 1/2 tsp. salt, and the pepper. Continue cooking until shrimp are pink with bright red tails and are completely opaque, about 3 more minutes.
Spoon grits into shallow bowls and top with shrimp and pan juices. Sprinkle with green onions, and if you like, drizzle with melted butter. Serve with hot sauce and more salt to add to taste.

name: Classic Cinnamon Rolls with Cream Cheese Icing
description: Cinnamon rolls are a crowd-favorite for good reason! Their fluffy texture, soft cinnamon centers, and rich, creamy icing make them completely irresistible. These cinnamon rolls are deliciously decadent, with generous icing, and the perfect treat for lazy mornings, holidays, and more. If you want to cut down on prep time the morning you serve them, prepare the cinnamon rolls through their second rise the night before, then cover and refrigerate for up to 18 hours. Let the rolls come to room temperature for 30 minutes before baking. The recipe, which makes 12 rolls, is a Yummly original created by [Annalise Sandberg](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/annalise-sandberg).
steps: Melt the 1/4 cup butter for rolls in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Once butter is melted, add milk and heat for 1 minute more, to 105° to 110°F on an instant-read thermometer. Pour mixture into bowl of a stand mixer (or a large mixing bowl, if you’ll be kneading by hand) and whisk in eggs and yeast. Add 2 1/2 cups flour, 2 Tbsp. granulated sugar, and 1 tsp. salt. Use a wire whisk to combine to make a wet, shaggy dough.

To knead dough with the stand mixer, fit the dough hook in place and knead dough on low speed, adding remaining 1 cup flour 1/4 cup at a time while kneading, and waiting until flour is incorporated before each addition. Add just enough flour so the dough clears the sides of the bowl and still feels soft and tacky to the touch, but doesn’t stick and come off on your fingers (you may need slightly more or less than the remaining 1 cup flour). Continue to knead dough until it’s smooth and elastic, 8-10 minutes total kneading time. Or, to knead dough by hand, transfer it to a floured work surface and knead, adding flour as required to prevent sticking, until dough is smooth and elastic, 8-10 minutes.
Bring dough into a ball, then return it to the bowl, cover and let it rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour (or 30 minutes if using instant yeast).

Gently punch down the risen dough and knead it with your hands a few times. Shape back into a ball and let it rest for a few minutes while you prepare the cinnamon roll filling. Melt the 1/4 cup butter for filling and set aside. Combine remaining 6 Tbsp. granulated sugar with the cinnamon in a separate bowl.

Grease a 9x13-inch baking pan and set aside. On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough into a rectangle approximately 12x17 inches, adding flour as needed to keep it from sticking. (If dough springs back and doesn’t roll out easily, cover with a towel and let it sit for 15 minutes before trying again.) Brush dough with melted butter to the edges and sprinkle evenly with the cinnamon-sugar mixture.

Starting with a long edge, gently roll up the dough into a long log, being careful not to push filling out as you go. Using a sharp knife or unscented dental floss, trim ends of the log so you have flat edges on each side. Slice dough into 2 equal halves, then divide each of those pieces in half again. Finally, divide those into 3 rolls, each about 1 1/2 inches wide. You should have 12 rolls.
Place sliced rolls evenly spaced into the 9x13-inch pan. Cover with plastic wrap and let rolls rise until puffed and almost doubled in size, 20-30 minutes. Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350°F.

Bake rolls until the tops just begin to turn golden brown and a digital thermometer inserted into the center of one roll reads 190°F, 20-25 minutes. (Do not overbake rolls or you’ll lose the soft centers.)

Meanwhile, prepare the cream cheese icing. Add cream cheese, 1/4 cup room temperature butter, the powdered sugar, 1 tsp. vanilla extract, and remaining 1/4 tsp. salt to mixer bowl. Beat on low speed until combined, then increase speed to medium and beat until smooth and creamy, pausing once to scrape down the bowl, 1-2 minutes.

Let the cinnamon rolls cool briefly in the pan for 5-15 minutes, or as desired, before spreading the cream cheese icing on top. The warmer the rolls are when you add the icing, the more the icing will melt over the cinnamon rolls. If you don’t want the icing to melt very much, wait at least 20 minutes before frosting the cinnamon rolls.
Cinnamon rolls are best enjoyed the day they are baked, but will keep in an airtight container at room temperature for 3 days or more.

name: Paleo Thai Seafood Soup
keywords: thai seafood soup with coconut milk

name: Akara: Fried Bean Fritters
description: This recipe is full of beans. Savor the sensation of dehulling them by hand — then batter up! Blend, deep-fry, and serve these perfect appetizer cakes with homemade ata din din sauce. For the ata din din portion of this dish, see the [Dodo & Ata Din Din recipe](https://www.yummly.com/recipe/Dodo-and-Ata-Din-Din_-Fried-Plantains-with-Stewed-Tomato_-Onion_-and-Bell-Pepper-Sauce-9307142) in Tunde Wey's recipe collection.

name: Roasted Branzino with Garlic, Olives, Sun-Dried Tomatoes and Fresh Herbs
description: Whole-roasting Branzino — a European sea bass — maximizes its flavor and nutrients. Served with a punchy roasted garlic sauce and vegetables, this healthy dish is as beautiful as it is delicious.

name: Chirchi
description: This well-seasoned blend of carrots and butternut squash is a universal condiment. It will make your rice, sandwich, or mezze platter pop with flavor and color.

name: Spicy Chicken Tagine
description: It's time to spice up your menu! Fragrant with harissa, preserved lemon, olives, oranges, and mint, this piquant chicken stew brings the flavors of a Moroccan souk to your kitchen.

name: Tom Yum Soup
description: The complex flavors in this iconic soup come from the wide array of Thai ingredients you'll learn to use: fresh lemongrass, galangal root, Thai lime leaves, fish sauce, nam prik pao, and more!

name: Fried Cauliflower with Pickled Raisins
description: Chef Einat has reimagined cooking cauliflower. In this exclusive video, she shares her original recipe and shows you how to make pickled raisins with baharat.

name: Hasselback Sweet Potatoes with Mushrooms and Bacon
description: Find out more about mushrooms and sweet potatoes, and learn to dish out a hassle-free feat of culinary architecture. After making this recipe, you'll grow to love it with every fiber of your being.

name: Kale Stem Pesto
description: Wen-Jay's fondness for kale stems from her belief in food as medicine. Here, she puts a health-nut spin on pesto and spreads the word on some easy ways to store this versatile sauce.

name: Melt-In-Your-Mouth Baked Chicken Breasts
description: These creamy, cheesy chicken breasts will, as their title says, melt in your mouth. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
Season the chicken breasts liberally on both sides with the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Arrange in a single layer in the prepared baking dish.
Stir together the mayonnaise and Greek yogurt in a small bowl. Spread the mixture evenly over the tops of the chicken breasts.
Sprinkle the Parmesan cheese evenly over the chicken breasts.
Bake the chicken breasts on middle rack of oven until the cheese is melted and lightly browned, and the chicken has reached an internal temperature of 160°F, 25-30 minutes.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Serve the chicken breasts immediately.

name: Easy Korean Sticky Chicken
description: The sweet and spicy flavors of this dish echo Korean fried chicken wings, but without the hassle of deep frying. Look for gochujang, a sweet and spicy Korean red pepper paste, in the International aisle of many grocery stores, at an Asian market, and online. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Julia Lee](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Julia-Lee).
steps: Thinly slice the green onions and set aside. Cut chicken into 1-inch pieces. Combine the chicken, salt, cornstarch, and water in a medium bowl. Set mixture aside.

Peel and finely grate the ginger using a hand-held rasp-style grater or box grater. Transfer ginger to a small mixing bowl. Grate or mince the garlic. Add it to the ginger with the gochujang, mirin, honey, sesame oil, and vinegar, and stir until well combined. Set sauce aside.

Heat a large, heavy-bottomed frying pan over medium-high heat. Once hot, add the oil, swirling to coat bottom of pan. Add the chicken and spread pieces into a single layer. Cook until well-browned on underside, 2-3 minutes. Turn pieces over and cook until browned on second side, 2-3 minutes. Transfer chicken to a bowl.
Reduce heat to medium-low and add sauce mixture to pan. Cook, stirring constantly, until hot, about 30 seconds. Return chicken to the pan and toss until well coated.
Transfer chicken to a serving plate. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds and green onions, and serve immediately.

name: Extra Creamy Scalloped Potatoes
keywords: cooking with half and half milk
description: Super rich scalloped potatoes are the perfect side to complete a special meal. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Spray a 9-inch square baking dish liberally with nonstick cooking spray.
Slice the potatoes uniformly 1/8 inch thick. Mince the garlic clove.
In a medium sauce pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Once melted, add the minced garlic and sauté for 30 seconds, just until fragrant.

Add the flour to the sauce pan. Whisk to combine the batter and flour into a thick paste. Continue whisking for 1 minute, until the roux turns slightly golden and begins to smell toasty. Slowly stream the milk and heavy cream into the pan while continuing to whisk.
Cook the mixture, whisking steadily, until it begins to thicken and bubble, 4-5 minutes.
Once bubbling, turn off the heat. Add salt and black pepper. Add the grated Parmesan and whisk slowly until the cheese is melted and the sauce is smooth.

Arrange half of the potatoes in the baking dish in an even layer. Lightly season with more salt and black pepper. Pour half of the cheese sauce on top. Sprinkle with half of the shredded cheese. Repeat with the remaining potatoes slices, sauce, and shredded cheese.
Bake the scalloped potatoes on middle rack of oven until the potatoes are tender and the dish is bubbling and browned on the top, 40-45 minutes.
Check to see that potatoes are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow the dish to cool for 10 minutes.
Garnish with chopped chives, if desired. Use a large spoon to plate the scalloped potatoes, and serve.

name: Easy 5-Ingredient Chicken Enchiladas
description: Restaurant-quality enchiladas have never been easier! These mouthwatering chicken- and cheese-filled corn tortillas are doused in spicy red sauce and baked in the oven. With just 5 ingredients and 10 minutes of hands-on time, you'll have a delicious dinner in less time than it takes to pick up takeout. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Spoon about 1/2 cup of enchilada sauce into the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish. Set aside.
Place the shredded chicken, shredded cheese, and 3/4 cup of the enchilada sauce in a large mixing bowl. Mix with a rubber spatula to combine.
Place a few tortillas on a dinner plate and warm in the microwave until pliable, 20-30 seconds. Repeat with remaining tortillas.

Spoon about 1/4 cup of the chicken and cheese mixture into the center of a tortilla. Gently roll the enchilada and place it seam-side down in the sauced casserole dish. Repeat with the remaining tortillas and filling.
Pour the remaining enchilada sauce evenly over the rolled tortillas. Sprinkle the shredded cheese over the top.
Cover the dish with a sheet of aluminum foil.
Bake the enchiladas on middle rack of oven for 20 minutes.
Carefully remove the foil and continue baking until edges are bubbling and cheese on top is slightly golden brown, 7-10 minutes.
Check to see that enchiladas are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow enchiladas to rest for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with cilantro, and serve.

name: Easiest Beef Meatloaf
description: With one bowl, minimal ingredients, and five minutes of prep time, this meatloaf is as easy as it is delicious. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 375°F. Spray an 8x4-inch loaf pan with nonstick cooking spray.
Mix together the ground beef, diced onion, salt, pepper, breadcrumbs, milk, and ketchup in a large bowl until thoroughly combined. Transfer mixture to the prepared loaf pan.
Bake the meatloaf on middle rack of oven for 40 minutes.
Open oven and spoon the ketchup in an even layer over top of meatloaf. Continue baking until center of loaf reaches 160°F, 15-20 minutes.
Check to see that meatloaf is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow meatloaf to rest for 10-15 minutes before serving. Scatter parsley on top if you like.

name: Honey-Dijon Pork Chops
description: Tender bone-in pork chops bake in a tangy sweet honey-Dijon mustard sauce. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.
Spray a 9x13-inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray.
In a medium mixing bowl, whisk together the Dijon, honey, mayonnaise, sour cream, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder until combined into a smooth dressing. Set aside.
Season the pork chops on both sides with salt and black pepper.

Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Place two pork chops in the skillet. Sear the pork, undisturbed, until browned on the bottom, 2-3 minutes. Flip the chops and sear for an additional 2 minutes on the other side. Transfer the pork chops to the baking dish.
Repeat the searing process with the remaining butter and pork chops.
Brush or spoon an equal amount of the honey-Dijon mixture over the top of each pork chop.
Bake the pork chops on the middle rack of oven until they have released some juices, 7-8 minutes.
Set the oven to broil. Broil the pork chops until the honey-Dijon topping is browned and the meat reaches an internal temperature of 140°F, 2-3 minutes.
Check to see that pork chops are done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow the pork chops to rest for 3 minutes. Plate the pork chops and serve immediately.

name: Baked Chicken Parmesan
keywords: boneless chicken breasts with mozzarella and panko
description: The Italian-restaurant favorite made healthier baked in the oven at home.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Set side.
Pat the chicken cutlets dry and season on both sides with the salt and black pepper.
Place the flour in a medium shallow bowl. In a second bowl, beat the egg until smooth. In a third bowl, combine the panko, Parmesan, and salt.

Dredge a chicken cutlet thoroughly in flour, then dip it in the beaten egg. Let the excess egg drip back into the bowl, then place cutlet in the Parmesan mixture, and turn until evenly coated. Transfer the cutlet to the prepared sheet pan. Repeat process with remaining chicken cutlets.
Spray the chicken liberally with nonstick cooking spray.

Bake the cutlets on middle rack of oven until beginning to brown, about 20 minutes. Turn cutlets over and spray once more with nonstick cooking spray. Continue baking until coating is golden and crispy and chicken reaches an internal temperature of 155°F, about 10 minutes longer.

Spoon the marinara sauce evenly over the cutlets. Sprinkle the shredded mozzarella evenly on top. Continue baking until mozzarella is melted, and chicken reaches an internal temperature of 165°F, about 5 minutes.
Check to see that chicken is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Serve immediately, with basil leaves on top if you like.

name: Easy Chicken and Broccoli Casserole
keywords: chicken casserole with cream of chicken soup
broccoli casserole cream of chicken soup
cream of chicken soup casserole chicken casserole
description: This is an easy, cheesy casserole that gets you in and out of the kitchen in 5 minutes.
steps: Preheat the oven to 350°F.

Place the shredded chicken, broccoli, cream of chicken soup, cheddar cheese, garlic powder, salt, and pepper in large mixing bowl and mix well to combine. Transfer the mixture to a 9x13-inch baking dish and spread it into an even layer.
Spread the shredded cheese evenly over the casserole.
Bake the casserole on middle rack of oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly, 25-30 minutes.
Check to see that casserole is done. Remove from oven or add time as needed.
Allow the casserole to cool for 5-10 minutes before serving.

name: Foolproof Savory Shepherd's Pie
keywords: shepherds pie potatoes corn and ground beef
description: Hearty, filling, shepherd's pie makes a delicious dinner for when you're craving comfort food. The recipe is a Yummly original created by [Sara Mellas](https://www.yummly.com/dish/author/Sara%20Mellas).
steps: Preheat the oven to 425°F.
Spray a 9-inch pie plate with nonstick cooking spray. Set aside.
Peel the potatoes and dice into 1/2-inch cubes.
Place the potatoes in a large pot filled with cold water. Set the pot over high heat and bring to a boil. Boil the potatoes until they can be easily pierced with a fork, 15-18 minutes.

Once tender, drain the potatoes in a large colander and return them to the pot. Add the butter, sour cream, salt, and black pepper. Mash the potatoes until smooth. Add milk and stir gently to combine.
Thinly slice the mushrooms.
Finely dice the onion.
Finely dice the carrot
Finely dice the celery.

In an extra-large skillet over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add mushrooms and salt. Sauté, stirring frequently, until the mushrooms have released their juices and are nicely browned, 5-6 minutes.
Transfer the mushrooms to a bowl and set aside.
Add the olive oil to the pan. When oil shimmers, add the onions, carrots, and celery. Sauté over medium-high heat, stirring frequently, until they are soft and translucent, 7-8 minutes.
Add the lean ground beef, thyme, nutmeg, salt and black pepper to the skillet. Sauté over medium-high heat, breaking beef up as it cooks, until browned and cooked through, 7-8 minutes.
Return mushrooms to skillet. Add the Worcestershire sauce, tomato paste, corn, and peas to the pan. Stir until the corn and peas are thawed, about 2 minutes.
